ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I believe that I gained a solid foundation in the language and was able to speak and communicate effectively on a basic level.

I developed the capacity to think about how to construct sentences in Spanish. I found myself playing with the idea of piecing together parts of basic sentences in Spanish instead of English. I learned about the cultures of different Latin American countries and the timeline of the Spanish language such as which other languages influenced it.
I developed the use of elementary spanish.
beginner-level Spanish vocabulary and grammar, knowledge about some Spanish-speaking countries

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course covers a lot of helpful material, however the course moved so fast that I felt that I could never truly absurd a topic before moving on. I also feel like the activities in class were fun but that test prep and conceptual reviews would be more helpful in place of theses activities. I also believe that more cumulative reviews would be beneficial.

The course is done well in conjunction with VHL Learning (Supersite) as that website gives good preparation for the grammatical structures we are to learn in class. In terms of weaknesses, the class is very fast paced. Sometimes too fast paced to learn from. The course covers a large amount of breadth, but rarely the depth necessary to truly understand anything. I feel like I was not given ample time to struggle with the language in class, as the curriculum was so faced paced that the professor was forced to move on and simply give me the answer. I feel like struggling with the language is a crucial step in learning the language and I wish I was given the chance to do so. I hope future students are given that chance.
I think a weakness of this course was too much extra assignments and work. The time spent on some of the extra assignments could have been used to study and practice the fundamentals.
It could potentially be improved by more group and class discussions with room to fail and struggle with the language.
The amount of professor teaching of concepts could be improved. Minimal strengths of this course.

strength: you acquire a working knowledge of a language by participating every day. weaknesses: the course moves extremely quickly. its often difficult to tell which concepts are important and which are just included as busy work. important concepts are often touched on once and then never revisited. everything is in spanish, so if you don't understand something you are quickly left behind. no time is allotted to solidify understanding before moving on to a completely new topic.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would, however I believe that students should be prepared to move at a very fast pace. I also feel like solid understanding of topics was valued less than the amount of material covered.

I would recommend this course to other students at Yale University, because it was intense enough to give me a good understanding of the language but not overwhelming to the point that I am discouraged from the language.
Yes, it is a great way to learn how to speak and understand spanish.
No. This course has an extremely high workload and lacks professor help.

languages are required so there's a good probability you'll have to take one. I think the course is decent but its kind of like drinking out of a fire hose so i'm not sure i'd recommend it for the casual language learner.
